1. "The Notebook" - A classic love story set in the 1940s about a poor and uneducated man who falls in love with a rich young woman.

5. "Crazy, Stupid, Love" - A romantic comedy about a middle-aged man (Steve Carell) who embarks on a journey to rediscover his mojo after his wife asks for a divorce, and meets a charming womanizer (Ryan Gosling) who helps him along the way.
6. "The Age of Adaline" - A romantic drama about a young woman (Blake Lively) who, due to an accidental mutation, remains ageless until she falls in love with a philanthropist (Michiel Huisman). The film explores themes of love, mortality, and the human condition.
7. "The Fault in Our Stars" - A tragic yet heartwarming romantic drama about two teenagers (Shailene Woodley and Ansel Elgort) who meet at a cancer support group and fall in love as they navigate their respective illnesses together.
